name: Indian Vegetable Bhaji
author: NP
summary: Bhaji is a fry, so do not add water and you will really enjoy the drier variety of an Indian curry. Great with breads like naan or paratha, or with rice and daal (Indian lentil soup).
directions: Place the potatoes, cauliflower florets, carrot, and peas into a microwave-safe bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and microwave on High until the vegetables are very hot and starting to soften, about 2 minutes
Remove the plastic wrap, and drain the vegetables in a colander
Place the vegetable oil in a large skillet, and heat over medium heat
Cook and stir the onion until it turns golden, about 10 minutes, and stir in the cumin seed, black mustard seed, and bay leaves
Cook and stir until the seeds begin to sputter, about 30 seconds, and then add the green chiles, garlic, and ginger
Cook and stir until the garlic begins to brown, about 1 minute
Stir in the ground cumin, curry powder, and chili powder, and then add the partially cooked potatoes, cauliflower, carrot, and peas
Cook and stir until the vegetables are tender and coated with spices, about 30 minutes
